channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: 22 new community cases as government to decide on alert levels
item.description: The Ministry of Health says 17 of today's 22 new community cases have been epidemiologically linked.

item.title: Live Covid-19 updates for 20 September: Cabinet decides on alert levels today
item.description: People in the small rural communities around the Hauraki Plains are turning out in force to get tested for Covid-19, after three people in the area tested positive.

item.title: Gang associates nabbed by cops on border run with cash and KFC
item.description: Police have arrested two gang associates they say were trying to get past Auckland's border on a back road, with a large quantity of cash and KFC.

item.title: Tears and cheers as thousands miss spots in MIQ offering
item.description: There has been disappointment and frustration for the 22,000 New Zealanders trying to get home through the MIQ system who missed out on places this morning.

item.title: NZ director of The Crown Jessica Hobbs wins Outstanding Director Emmy award
item.description: New Zealand director Jessica Hobbs has won an Emmy award for The Crown.

item.title: Hastings state housing project delayed by squeeze on construction supply chain
item.description: At least one state housing project has been delayed by the squeeze on the construction industry supply chain.

item.title: Covid-19: Auckland Mayor calls for shift to level 3 this week
item.description: Phil Goff wants the region shifted down to alert level 3 this week, and says the cost to stay at level 4 is too high.

item.title: Auckland single mum loses $200k to scammers posing as Chinese officials
item.description: An Auckland single mum has to work two jobs to support her family after losing $200,000 to scammers posing as Chinese officials.

item.title: Unconsented work being overlooked in hot property market
item.description: A shortage of property listings is pushing desperate buyers to consider defective houses with works that are not consented.

item.title: Bailing prisoner outside region 'totally irresponsible' - Waikato District Mayor
item.description: Waikato District Mayor Allan Sanson is furious a Mt Eden prisoner was bailed outside Auckland to the area where cases of Covid-19 have now been discovered.

item.title: More supply chain woes as ferry capacity shrinks
item.description: Supermarkets have been stocking up and South Island construction companies are bracing for even more shortages with two Interislander ferries out from today.

item.title: Fire crews battling Penrose warehouse blaze
item.description: Fourteen fire crews from across Auckland are battling to bring a blaze under control at a warehouse on Great South Road in Auckland.

item.title: Southland Polyfest goes online to cope with restrictions
item.description: Murihiku-Southland's Polyfest's live event has been cancelled due to ongoing restrictions as a result of the Delta outbreak.

item.title: Evidence Waikato Covid-19 cases likely linked to current cluster - Robertson
item.description: The small Waikato community where new cases of Covid-19 have emerged has been told to isolate and get a Covid-19 test, the deputy prime minister says.

item.title: Photographer takes first steps three months after helicopter crash
item.description: A photographer seriously injured in a wedding day helicopter crash says she hopes to reunite with the couple and document their second wedding day on their first anniversary.

item.title: Aimee Fisher wins world title after 'the hardest 12 months'
item.description: The New Zealand kayaker won gold in the women's K1 500 on the final day of the world canoe sprint championships in Denmark.

item.title: Epidemiologist Michael Baker on Waikato Covid-19 cases: 'It does change things'
item.description: The government should consider the option of extending Auckland's alert level boundary to part of Waikato because of the discovery of Covid-19 cases there, epidemiologist Michael Baker says.

item.title: Man convicted of people trafficking and slavery takes case to Supreme Court
item.description: A Hastings man convicted of people trafficking and slavery is taking his case to the Supreme Court after his attempts to have his convictions overturned were dismissed by the Court of Appeal.
